intro: Allosorus tinaei, commonly known as the tinaei lichen, is a species of crustose lichen found in specific geographic regions. It belongs to the family Caloplacaceae and is characterized by its intricate thallus structure. The lichen forms a dense, flat growth on rocks or soil, often in shaded, moist environments. Its reproductive structures, known as soredia, are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation. Allosorus tinaei plays a vital role in ecological systems by contributing to soil stabilization and serving as a food source for various invertebrates.
